CONJUGATES: coherently (adverb) | coherence (noun) | more coherent (comparative) | most coherent (superlative)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin cohaerens, present participle of cohaerere ('to cling together, be connected'), from co- ('together') + haerere ('to stick, cling').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Logically connected, consistent, and easy to understand; having parts that fit together well.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 连贯的；条理清楚的；一致的（指论述、思想等）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was too upset to give a coherent description of what happened.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她心烦意乱，无法清楚地描述发生了什么。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of waves, especially light) having a constant phase relationship so that interference effects can occur.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 相干的；相位相干的（指波或光）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Laser light is much more coherent than light from a standard bulb.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 激光比普通灯泡发出的光更加相干。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Sticking together; forming a unified or integrated whole.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The soil was sufficiently coherent to form clumps.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 土壤足够紧密，可以形成土块。
